attributes.action: Post study work visa should be introduced again for tier4 international students
attributes.background: Post study work visa was valid till 2012. Now winning a lottery might be an easy task for an international student  ( that too is not a good example because of no public funds clause) but getting a job with tier 2 specifications is a nightmare for the students who arrive here on loans and much more.

attributes.action: Ban Fines for Parking Ticket Mistakes
attributes.background:
Honest people who have purchased valid parking tickets are being fined because of genuine mistakes - such as accidentally mistyping number plates in car parks that use number plate recognition. 

The British Parking Association know this - but their appeal system but offers no help.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has nothing to do with fines for overstaying or not purchasing a ticket - this is for genuine mistakes.

Typically people have a single character wrong on their ticket - and still appeals side with the car park owners.

To anyone else - it would be clear that the driver had made a genuine mistake, and paid the correct amount for the time allocated.

This money making on genuine mistakes should be stopped.

A typing error should not cost someone £60+

attributes.action: To make it easier for grandparents to get parental Responsibility
attributes.background: Fathers, same sex parents and step parents can get PR by downloading the form and taking it to the local court to be witnessed and signed and that’s it they have PR.
attributes.additional_details: Grandparents have to get mediation and then apply to the family court for permission to apply for a residence order or special guardianship order which can all take months. How can this be right over 200,000 grandparents are bringing up one of more of their grandchildren. I realise children have to be protected and made safe but making it this hard for grandparents to get PR is not doing this.

attributes.action: Tighten the regulations on who can give Botox
attributes.background:
At the moment anyone can administer Botox after it has been prescribed.
I think only medical professionals should be able to administer Botox into clients.
e.g. Doctors, surgeons, dentists and nurses.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently had a procedure done by an unqualified person who then left my face drooping down and paralysed.  I am one of many women who have suffered.  
Botox is a controlled substance this has to be prescribed by a doctor dentist or nurse prescriber.  At the moment who injects the Botox after this can be any one with no medical background. The dangers of this can be blindness , paralysed muscles and anaphylactic shock which can be fatal.

attributes.action: Establish a Public Service Production Company thats funded by the British public
attributes.background: Our film industry is currently a subsidiary of the US film industry. US Film Companies are incentivised by the Government to produce their films in the UK through tax rebates and breaks Instead of financially supporting the US industry the Government needs to financially support it's own
attributes.additional_details:
The petitions asks for the establishment of a publicly owned and funded film production company that produces films which serve a public interest. 

References http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-28213379 http://ask.ofcom.org.uk/help/television/what_is_psb http://www.newstatesman.com/culture/2015/03/we-dont-have-british-film-industry-business-film-takes-us-behind-movie-scenes

attributes.action: Amend Hate Speech Laws
attributes.background: "Hate Crime is any criminal offence [...] which is perceived to be motivated by hostility or prejudice." Law enforcement will find it difficult to fully determine the motivations behind the speech or actions. As such, the law should be changed to "proven to be motivated by" to avoid ambiguity.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to charge a single room supplement
attributes.background: This is a petition to ask parliament to make it illegal for hoteliers and tour operators to apply a surcharge to the hotel or holiday booking of anyone travelling on their own. It is routine in the travel industry for a holidaymaker to pay a supplement for occupying a single-bedded hotel room.
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken with several people who often have to travel on their own, many of them believing the supplement to be unfair and unnecessary, especially as there is usually nothing special about the single rooms they are allocated. In my experience, there isn't usually anything exceptional offered in the single room which one could say would attract a surcharge. The rooms are usually tiny, with neither room to "swing a cat", nor a particularly special view outside the window. If you agree that single travellers face unfair discrimination, please sign the petition.

attributes.action: Make unpaid internships illegal, National Minimum Wage compulsory after 2 weeks.
attributes.background: Unpaid Internships are used by companies in the fashion & creative industry that are worth millions. This use of free labour is exploitative. It increases elitism and classism within the chosen roles and does not give everyone a fair chance to pursue their future career.
attributes.additional_details: In 2018 it is unbelievable that not just students, but graduates are forced to work for free for up to a year after graduating if they have selected an arts/fashion based subject. If these individuals do not live in London or have their parents to contribute to their income it can cost £1,019 monthly according to The Sutton Trust. The majority of these companies are worth millions and can afford labour at NMW. These individuals are exploited, with no income and no promise of future employment.

attributes.action: Make all ESA & PIP assessment centres fully accessible.
attributes.background: Too many people are arriving for a DWP disability assessment to discover they cannot get into the building due to steps, stairs or staff only lifts. Many of these people are being told they should have informed the assessment providers they required wheelchair access beforehand. This has to stop.

attributes.action: Govt take action to protect UK citizens in Kerala regarding elephant parades
attributes.background: Every year UK citizens visit Kerala to watch religious ceremonies exploiting captive elephants. The elephants are subjected to the most horrific cruelties in order to control them. The ceremonies always take place during musth season so the elephants are regularly running amock and harming people.
attributes.additional_details: It's important the Govt informs UK citizens of high risk of danger to human lives.

attributes.action: Ban plastic drinking straws in pubs, cafes, cinemas and restaurants.
attributes.background: The use of plastic drinking straws in establishments that sell liquid refreshment, either alcoholic or non alcoholic should be banned. They are unnecessary, a waste of plastic as they are for single use only, harmful to the environment, land and sea creatures.

attributes.action: Grant diplomatic status to Julian Assange so that he can leave the UK
attributes.background: Julian Assange of Wikileaks cannot leave the Ecuadorian Embassy in London because he fears arrest & extradition to the USA. Swedish prosecutors have dropped a rape investigation. The UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention has found that he is subject to arbitrary detention.
attributes.additional_details: There is still a UK arrest warrant for Julian Assange for a breach of bail conditions related to the now dropped rape investigation. The issue is that the UK Government will not guarantee his safe passage.

attributes.action: Restrict child benefit to the first two children in a family
attributes.background: The population of the world generally and of the UK specifically is growing at an alarming rate. The government should not be subsidising parents who choose to have larger families. It is therefore proposed that child benefit should be capped at two children per family

attributes.action: Debate the relevance of the Right to Buy legislation
attributes.background: Because of the increasing number of homeless families/single people, this request asks that Parliament debates the relevancy of the Right to Buy legislation, considering whether by revoking it thereby leaving more homes under Council control the numbers of homeless might decrease.
attributes.additional_details: I recently saw a discussion on the television where the particular Council responding to a question concerning their inability to house homeless families/single people said that for every three properties they built, two others of their stock went for 'right to buy'. I know little of the problems of Councils housing people nor of the Right to Buy Legislation but it seems to me possible that those that introduced the legislation may not have anticipated todays number of homeless.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists filtering on blind side and apply 1.5m rule in all cases
attributes.background: Cyclist's are putting themselves in danger passing through tiny gaps on blind side where they are not seen by motorists and should abide by the 1.5m passing rule to avoid causing dangerous road conditions and damage to vehicles where cyclists aren't insured

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid to £2B and use the balance for UK Defence and Public Services.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget of  0.7% of GDP is an arbitrary target which sees the UK actually borrow money to then give it away to foreign countries. At a time of such worldwide insecurity, this money would be much better spent on the UK's Armed Forces and on helping the NHS & other Public Services.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all new vehicles to be fitted with a tracking device
attributes.background: Car theft is rising in the UK with the vast majority being uninvestigsted by the police either though budget cuts or lack of evidence. This is why all new vehicles sold in the UK should be factory fitted with a tracking device. This will make car theft a thing of the past.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.easier.com/93725-stolen-cars-fitted-tracker-recovered.html

http://eb-iaati.org/news/entry/uk_chance_of_getting_your_stolen_car_back_drops_to_less_than_50_per_cent

attributes.action: Give equal state pension to every state pensioner
attributes.background: Back in April 2016 the government introduced a new state pension of £155/week for state pensioners but if you were already a state pensioner i.e. pre April 2016 your state pension remained the same £125 per week surely this cannot be fair or just why should any state pensioner get £30 a week more.
attributes.additional_details: I am very vexed about this scenario if we were talking of a few pence but this is serious money approx. £30 per week or £120 per month I feel the government has created a two tier pension scheme one for rich state pensioners post April 2016 and one for poor state pensioners pre April 2016 I feel this is totally unfair as I am on the pre 2016 rate after having paid in over 38 years of national insurance contributions why should I receive less money per month than a "new pensioner".

attributes.action: Make promoting Paedophilia a criminal offence
attributes.background:
It's time for the UK Parliament to better protect and deliver justice for our children by proving to the British People that they believe Paedophilia to be abhorrent. 
Paedophilia has been promoted by speakers at a conference held at the University of Cambridge in 2013.

attributes.action: Make more council houses and flats
attributes.background: There are to many family's and single people suffering about not having homes we need to make sure that nobody should be homeless in this day and age families or people should feel safe
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken to people living on the streets also have seen to many programmes on this subject the government needs to take action

attributes.action: Stop councils charging for DIY waste at recycling sites.
attributes.background: The relevant government department has stated that these charges should not be imposed. Any discouragement to the proper disposal of DIY waste will contribute to the increase in fly tipping.

attributes.action: Require routine scans for head and neck cancer patients after remission
attributes.background: Head and neck cancer patients are not routinely scanned after remission due to protocol. Even though a certain amount of patients have had metastasis from this source of cancer, which has gone from a highly curable cancer to a terminal diagnosis. Scans every 3-6 months should be a requirement.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 Andrew Davis was diagnosed with SCC of the tonsil. He underwent 30 radiotherapy and 1 chemotherapy. He was then given the all clear in June 2016. After this his life started to get better. In June 2017, Andrew became unwell and was given the news he had Secondary Liver Mets, no evidence of disease in head and neck area but the cells in his liver were from that source that had broken away during treatment. We are petitioning for head and neck patients to be scanned routinely.

attributes.action: Introduce an Act making it mandatory to manufacture British passports in the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom should, like many other countries, restrict where it's passports are made and  insist that it's passports are manufactured, by law,  in the United Kingdom by a United Kingdom registered company.

attributes.action: Make it a legal right for on duty ambulances to use bus lanes.
attributes.background:
It is apparent that NHS Trusts are being fined when Ambulances use bus lanes.

It should be legal for all on duty ambulances to use bus lanes, this will increase productivity and reduce costs for our already hard pressed NHS
attributes.additional_details: NHS Trust in Birmingham being fined up to £900 per day

attributes.action: There should be centrally funded, free, total and complete care for the elderly
attributes.background: I want to free the elderly from the huge burden of trying to fund their own care at the end of their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to free the local authority from the burden of trying to fund care of the elderly when they do not have the money
I want to free the families from the burden of having to make up any shortfall in funding in order to give their loved ones the complete care they need
I want to see some meaningful return for the taxes we have paid throughout our working lives
Finally, it is the mark of a civilised nation that the state safeguards and has a duty of care towards the elderly: the most vulnerable In our society

attributes.action: Make branding or freeze branding of animals a criminal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Many horses and cattle in the UK are branded using heated iron or frozen metal (freeze branding). This is cruel, causing severe pain and is unnecessary when micro-chipping is cheap and quick. It could even be made illegal without new legislation by enforcing existing anti-cruelty laws.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information
https://www.rspca.org.uk/adviceandwelfare/pets/horses/health/identification
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows/

attributes.action: Restore Nursing bursaries
attributes.background:
The shortage of nursing staff is adversely affecting patient care 
Scrapping nursing bursaries has affected the recruitment of nurses
Nursing is one of the most valuable professions , and should be supported in every way possible

attributes.action: Councils should be able to nominate people to a different council for downsizing
attributes.background: The Government should extend the Right to Move to tenants who want to downsize. There are so many council tenants under occupying properties that bigger families desperately need.
attributes.additional_details: All councils & housing associations should be giving tenants an incentive to move out of these bigger properties, like allowing a tenant to be nominated to a borough of the tenants choice. Local authorities shouldn’t be allowed to apply a local connection test if it could disadvantage tenants who need or want to move across local authority boundaries to downsize.

attributes.action: Stop all serving politicians from being included in any Honours lists
attributes.background: Time and time again who ever is in government are seen to be rewarding loyal members of their party even if they aren't doing a good job. Being Knighted for sitting on a committee or being a loyal party member isn't good enough and is making a joke of the whole system.

attributes.action: Send a force to free people that are being enslaved in Libya
attributes.background: Are we the generation to be remembered for allowing slavery back? People are being enslaved in Libya in broad daylight and the World knows. It is unacceptable that only lip service has been paid to such a violation of human life. We have been complicit in these evil acts by our failure to act.
attributes.additional_details:
Libya migrant 'slave market' footage sparks outrage - BBC News - http://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-42038451

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://amp.timeinc.net/time/5042560/libya-slave-trade&ved=0ahUKEwi3-Zyv0ZbYAhVQ_KQKHZ7CAIgQFggkMAA&usg=AOvVaw1OKyfqviElPGxqFMjSAiJR&ampcf=1

attributes.action: Pressure video sharing sites to remove violent/graphic videos targeted at kids
attributes.background: The online safety of our kids is not being taken seriously by video sharing sites like YouTube. There are hundreds maybe thousands of videos being masked as our children's favourite cartoons. More needs to be done to remove this content before it is published!

attributes.action: Let the people decide whether Brexit included the single market & customs union
attributes.background: This petition requires the UK Governemnt to clarify by public vote before March 2018 whether the intention of referendum voters was to leave membership of the EU only, or also to leave the single market and customs union and related institutions as extrapolated by the UK Government.

attributes.action: Specialised glasses for the colour-blind on the NHS
attributes.background:
Imagine opening you eyes every morning and everything is browns yellows and dark blues.
Imagine growing up realising there's a whole new world of colours, yet your unable to see what others see. Reds, pinks, purples, oranges, light blues are some of the basic colours that a victim of Deuteranopia
attributes.additional_details:
My aim in this petitions is to try and fight to get glasses for the colour-blind available on the NHS. Why? 
•Children experiencing difficulty at school if colours are used to help with learning 
•Problems with food, such as identifying whether meat is fully cooked or whether fruit is ripe 
•Getting medications confused 
•Trouble identifying safety warnings or signs 
•Slightly limited career choices – certain jobs, such as pilots, train drivers and electricians

attributes.action: Spend at least 60 billion pounds every year in Defense by 2020
attributes.background: We, as well as British and US military officials, ask that the UK government increases the armed forces defense budget so we are able to protect our country from states such as Russia and North Korea. We must stop cuts to our armed forces at this critical time, to counter the threats that face today
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-41903960

attributes.action: Require all pubs and clubs to have metal detectors
attributes.background: By making it a legal requirement to have metal detectors at the entrances of pubs and clubs we could prevent people from even carrying a knife on a night out; fear of it being found and leading to a criminal offence of carrying a deadly weapon.
attributes.additional_details: The security staff on pubs and clubs are there to protect customers and adhere to rules and policies of the venue –how can they protect someone from a knife if they are unaware of someone entering with a weapon of such.

attributes.action: Make it that front number plates do not have to be shown on a motor vehicle
attributes.background: Make it so that on a motor vehicle that you don’t have to display a front number plate.

attributes.action: Make all advertisers state if their images have been doctored.
attributes.background: Both France and Israel have made it law that advertisers must put on their packaging that their images have been doctored. This is to stop the presentation of false body image. Britain should follow in their example.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, there have been instances where celebrities such as Kate Winlslet have made it public that images of them have been doctored. It should not be up to the models and celebrities to state this. There are countless doctored images that the public aren't aware about, that are constantly thrown in our faces. Advertisers should clearly state that their images have been doctored, as this can give some people the need to get the perfect body, which is obviously made up by some advertisers.

attributes.action: Stop companies asking for payment details for free trials of services.
attributes.background: For Free trials of services companies request payment details for the said trials. Failure to terminate at the end of a trial would normal mean services are charged for the next billing period. They should provide a option to terminate at point of  registering for free trail or terminate at expiry
attributes.additional_details:
Netflix
Linked in 
NOW TV  and so many more
They are all are relying on some income from those that forget to terminate. A free trial in good faith would not require payment method. It should be illegal not to auto terminate or give the option to terminate at the point of registering

attributes.action: Move PMQ's to prime time on Tuesdays
attributes.background:
Prime Minister's Questions should be moved from 12pm on Wednesday to Tuesday evenings.

This will increase the amount of people able to watch PMQ's and participate in democracy in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: I suggest Tuesdays as the best day as there aren't other popular shows on on a Tuesday, increasing the audience.

attributes.action: Clearing pavements of ice should not bring legal liability if someone then falls
attributes.background: The law is such that persons clearing public pavements of snow and ice, e.g. outside their house or business, are then liable for civil action in the event someone slips, whereas not clearing the ice means you are not responsible, and thus can't be sued. The result is more dangerous pavements.
attributes.additional_details:
While the principle of "liability where actions have been taken" is sound, in this case it results in a less beneficial outcome. 
Government advice is "you're unlikely to be sued", but that is hardly encouraging. https://www.gov.uk/clear-snow-road-path-cycleway

There will always be a grey area where the use of inappropriate methods (like warm water) should be admissible when determining blame, but in the absence of such proof, the intent to clear ice in itself should not bring liability.

attributes.action: Ban plastic cotton buds
attributes.background: The sale and manufacture of plastic-stemmed cotton buds is to be banned under new Scottish government plans. England should follow suit as the plastic stems of cotton buds kill 1000s of marine species every year along the coastline.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish government can take action and ban plastic being used to make cotton buds so can we. People flush plastic cotton buds down the toilet and many end up in the ocean and as a result they are washed up on our beaches. Not only is this devastating for ecosystems but also for the health of our beautiful coastline. With alternatives such as paper cotton buds available, there is really no need to use plastic.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ask for someone’s previous salary.
attributes.background:
The salary negotiation process, and specifically the gender salary gap is directly affected by a company knowing a person’s previous salary. 

The salary band for the role should be defined for the role, and based on the responsibility and scope.

This shouldn’t be based on the previous salary.
attributes.additional_details: Previous salary should be treated like date of birth or age, gender, disability or trade union membership.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring cattle allowed to graze grass outside min. 8 hours per day
attributes.background: Many dairy cattle are kept in sheds for up to 24 hours a day, in some cases all year. They're fed diets which aren't healthy or natural for them. As a result of this, over-milking and preventing movement they typically become ill and are killed at 3 to 5 years old. Their natural lifespan is 20 years
attributes.additional_details:
Scientific studies & other information
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17033013
https://stud.epsilon.slu.se/5285/1/kivling_s_130215.pdf
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
http://www.research.ed.ac.uk/portal/en/publications/housing-system-milk-production-and-zerograzing-effects-on-lameness-and-leg-injury-in-dairy-cows(117d66b0-cd77-4c79-82f6-d15053cd02fb).html

attributes.action: Release the 2012 NHS reform risk Assessment.
attributes.background: In 2012, the Health Secretary vetoed the publication of the risk assessment relating to the changes introduced in the Health and Social Care Act. The Information Commissioner's office declared that in the circumstances this was unreasonable and requested they be released.
attributes.additional_details: This petition requests that said document is released in the name of transparency.  No law was implemented to allow the government to pursue its current restructuring of the NHS and a reorganisation was guaranteed to be "off the cards" by the prime minister.  The current government has no mandate to reorganise the NHS and create ACOs.  We request access to the risk assessment in order to see if this was predicted prior to the 2012 HaSCA and whether the current collapse of the NHS was preventable

attributes.action: Bring forward the 2020 London Mayoral Elections to 2019.
attributes.background: The 2020 London mayoral elections should be brought forward from 2020 to 2019 in order to de-conflict with a possible general election also due 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The current London assembly is running with the idea that the election should be delayed until 2021 because of the chance of a general election in the same year (2020). This will give the current mayor an extra 12 months in power without being re-elected.

Londoners should be given the opportunity to select a new mayor sooner rather than later. The people of London must be given the chance to rid themselves of the massive increase in crime associated with the current mayor.

attributes.action: Make Paper Carrier Bags & Packaging compulsory for shops and manufacturers
attributes.background: The Government introduced the 5p charge on carrier bags in shops they are now planning to implement it across all. BUT what they should be doing is stopping plastic being used- Paper Carrier Bags and packaging is far better for us and can be recycled easily this would be Enviromentally safer.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic carrier bags get into the water supply and sea causing harm to wild life and also in long run the food chain - Paper can be made to be biodegradable so if dumped would not cause harm to wild life and so would not harm us - let the UK 🇬🇧 be a world leader in starting to bring back the classic Paper Carrier Bags for shops and then front leader in Paper or biodegradable card for packaging for manufacturers

attributes.action: Government facilitate a cross party group of MP’s to assess the needs of the NHS
attributes.background: Suggest political parties stop using the problems the NHS faces for political gain and to work together to improve it for patients and employees of the service. To co-operate with each other to find the best solutions to maintaining a sustainable high level of health care for everyone.
attributes.additional_details:
The group could analyse other successful health care schemes, their procedures, expenditure measured against results. Do hospital and GP procedures need to change?

Is the British health care system working so well that it only needs more funds? If so, how can further funds be raised without increasing the national debt? All of these questions will be more credible to all political parties if answered by a cross party group of MP’s.

attributes.action: To make it law that all public places to have a defibrillator on site
attributes.background: On the 23rd a December I was at a non league football match, a spectator suffered a cardiac arrest. The club had a defibrillator on site and that saved the mans life.
attributes.additional_details: I was going make the petition about non league football grounds having a defibrillator, I have decided to make it all public places. For example every supermarket , football ground and shopping centre must have a defibrillator.

attributes.action: Provide increase support for parents with disabilities and their children
attributes.background: Children who have parents with disabilities are only able to access free school meals, the nursery grant for 2 year olds and pupil premium if they are on income related benefits. This means many working parents with a disabled partner are left better off leaving work to care for their families.
attributes.additional_details: Where a parent is on PIP they are considered “incapacitated” for childcare purposes in tax credit legislation and for extended hours nursery provision for 3 year olds. This does not extend to pupil premium, 2 year old nursery places or to free school meals - even if the incapacitated parent is unable to prepare a meal for themselves. Where one parent works and the other is considered incapacitated, children should receive these in order for the working parent to remain in work.

attributes.action: Ban the testing of household cleaning product ingredients on animals.
attributes.background: There is no law in the UK that bans the testing of cleaning products on animals. This is a cruel practice with no practical use whatsoever. I urge you to please sign this petition if you , like me love animals and do not want to see them suffer.
